726916f-a.text:
Hoyt Avenue, south side, west from 24th to 23rd Streets. In the foreground is a small sheet-metal vegetable store and the rears of several houses fronting on the east side of 23rd Street. At the S.W. corner of the latter is an old farmhouse, having been part of the Hallett property in 1873.
P. L. Sperr  March 14, 1931

726915f-a.text:
Hoyt Avenue (left), at 23rd Street, viewing northwestward across the area that was cleared of its numerous buildings and where the Triborough Bridge was constructed. One of the concrete anchorages of the bridge an be seen in the center background.

P. L. Sperr    May 27, 1934

725132f-a.text:
23rd Street, south from Hoyt Avenue. The tree in the lower right hand corner shrouds from view a very old farmhouse. Above the tree appears Public School No. 7. Some mid-Manhattan skyscrapers are in the upper right hand corner.

P. L. Sperr  July 25, 1936

726913f-b.text:
Hoyt Avenue, at the S.W. corner of 23rd Street, showing an old farm house. It was part of the S.J. Hallett property
in 1873.

P. L. Sperr  View 1: March 13, 1931
View 2: May 27, 1934
View 3: July 25, 1936

726914f-c.text:
Hoyt Avenue, north side, at 23rd Street, viewing northwestward across empty lots toward the Hellgate Bridge. The Triborough Bridge was later thrown across here.

View 1: March 13, 1931
P. L. Sperr  View 2: August 3, 1934
View 3: September 20, 1934
